\_sh v3.0  621  Text

\id Con 100: Pledge of Allegiance
\ref Con100.001
\tx Niih'oowoohunoo       woohoniihi'          yiisiihi'               niiwohoe.
\mb niih'oowoohu   - noo  woohon-        iihi' yiis-     iihi'         niiwohoe
\ge IC.pledge, vow - 1S   come together- ADV   to there- ADV           flag
\ps vai (sp?)      - infl prefix-        deriv prefix-   deriv ni

\ft I adopt the principles associated with this flag.
\notes Original was niiho'oowohunoo. Possibly intended heniihkohoo'oo- 'oath, take an oath'??? But see also
niitoowoohu- 'pledge, make oath' (not a real form??)
\ref Con100.002
\tx Hee3oo'    woohoniiteen,            nuhu'        heetoono'.
\mb hee3oo'    woohon-        iiteen    nuhu'        heetoo        - no'
\ge where from come together- nation    this         where located - 12   
\ps vii.rel    prefix-        ni det vai.rel.    - infl

\ft And to the united country (republic) of which we are.
\ref Con100.003
\tx Noh  bisiihi'            hee3eenoo'.
\mb noh  bis-    iihi'       hee3eenoo      - '
\ge and  all-    ADV         why done/be    - 0S
\ps part prefix- deriv vii.rel. - infl  
\ft And all that it represents.
\ref Con100.004
\tx Neniiseti' hiiteen,
\mb neniiseti' hiiteen
\ge IC.one     nation
\ps vii        ni
\ft One nation,
\ref Con100.005
\tx Beeheeteiht                    hitooxuwuut.
\mb beeheeteihi             - t    hit-  ooxuwuut
\ge IC.all powerful/creator - 3.S  3S-   authority
\ps na/vai             - infl infl- ni
\ft [Under] God's commands.
\ref Con100.006
\tx Hoowuuni'honkuuh.
\mb hoow-        uu-     ni'-    honkuuhu
\ge 0.NEG-       IMPERF- able-   overturned/thrown down(?)
\ps infl+prefix- prefix- prefix- vii.pass
\ft It cannot be destroyed.
\ref Con100.007
\tx hoowce'eseenebetiitoon.
\mb hoow-        ce'eseenebetiitooni
\ge 0.NEG-       people are considered different/unequal
\ps infl+prefix- vii.impers
\ft Nobody is discriminated against.
\ref Con100.008
\tx beiscectoniihi'.
\mb beis-   cecton- iihi'
\ge IC.all- equal-  ADV
\ps prefix- prefix- deriv 
\ft All are equal.

\id Con 123: Lloyd Dewey's recollections of a speech heard at a pow-wow
\ref Con123.001

\ge IC.be a lot IMPERF- want to- known           - 0S
\ps vii         prefix- prefix-  vii.pass.imperf - infl

\ft There's a lot you want to know.

\tx Woow     neihoowhooxuwuuneniin.
\mb woow     neihoow-     hooxuwuuneniini
\ge now.PERF 1.NEG-       be in charge,      administrator
\ps part     infl+prefix- vai.incorp

\ft Right now I am not a person in charge.

\tx Wo'ei3 hoono'  hoowuuni,  hoono'  [nei]hoowee3neeniini
\mb wo'ei3 hoono'  hoowuuni   hoono'  neihoow-     ee3neen-     iini
\ge or     not yet no/not     not yet 1.NEG-       really/very- DETACH
\ps part   part    prefix.det part    infl+prefix- prefix-      deriv

\tx cee'iyeihiinen.
\mb cee'iyeihiinen

\ps na

\ft Or I am not yet really in a position to govern.

\tx Wo'ei3 hinee niit3ii3i'oku3i'                         nih'oo3ou'u,

\id Conathan 101: Lord's Prayer
\ref Con101.001
\tx Beehiiniisonoonibeihin.
\mb beehiiniisonoonibeihi - n
\ge IC.be father of all   - 2S
\ps vai                   - infl

\ft You are the father of all.
\ref Con101.002
\tx Neneenin       hihcebe' heentoon.
\mb neneeni-  n    hihcebe' heentoo  - n
\ge IC.it is- 2S   above    IC.be at - 2S
\ps vai-      infl part.loc vai      - infl
\ft You are in heaven.
\ref Con101.003
\tx Heniisih'iit     tohbeteenoo'.
\mb he-   niisih'iit toh-    beteenoo    - '
\ge 2S-   name       since-  sacred/holy - 0S
\ps infl- ni         prefix- vii         - infl
\ft Let your name is sacred.
\ref Con101.004
\tx Heetihni'iine'etiiwoohun                  heetihno'useenoo'.
\mb heetih-  ni'-       iine'etiiwoohu - n    heetih-  no'useenoo - '
\ge so that- good/well- survive        - 2S   so that- arrive     - 0S
\ps prefix-  prefix-    vai            - infl prefix-  vii        - infl
\ft Let the good life come.
\ref Con101.005
\tx Hinee heesi3ecoon                heetihnee'eesoo'.
\mb hinee heesi3ecoo          - n    heetih-  nee'eesoo  - '
\ge that  what/how X thinks   - 2S   so that- it is thus - 0S
\ps det   vai.REL             - infl prefix-  vii.back   - infl
\ft Let your will be done.
\ref Con101.006
\tx Teesiihi'      biito'owu' hinee heesoo'.
\mb tees-    iihi' biito'owu' hinee heesoo'
\ge on/over- ADV   land       that  how it is
\ps prefix-  deriv ni         det   vii.rel
\ft How it is on this earth.
\ref Con101.007
\tx Hihcebe' hinee heetoon.
\mb hihcebe' hinee heetoo        - n
\ge above    that  where located - 2S
\ps part.loc det   vai.rel       - infl
\ft [As it is] in heaven where you are.
\ref Con101.008
\tx Cihbiinei'ee                 nuhu' hiisi' heeyowuuhu'       nebii3hiininoo.
\mb cih-        biin - ei'ee     nuhu' hiisi' heeyow-     uuhu' ne-   bii3hiin    - inoo
\ge EMPH.IMPER- give - 1PL.IMPER this  day    every time- ADV   1S-   thing eaten - pers.PL
\ps prefix-     vta  - infl      det   ni     proclitic-  deriv infl- vai.deppart - infl
\ft Give us each this day our food.
\ref Con101.009
\tx Heetihkouutenowuunei'een                   neeneisnontooni'.
\mb heetih-  kouutenowuun             - ei'een neeneis-                 nontoo       - ni'
\ge so that- get rid of s.t. for s.o. - 2S/1PL what/how-                make mistake - 1PL
\ps prefix-  vta                      - infl   prefix.rel.REDUP.IMPERF- vai          - infl
\ft Absolve/do away with the things we do wrong.
\ref Con101.010
\tx Heetihkouutenowuunoono'                   heiciini'iheiitoonin.
\mb heetih-  kouutenowuun             - oono' hei-         cii-    ni'ih      - eiitoonin
\ge so that- get rid of s.t. for s.o. - 12/3  2S.IMPERF-   NEG-    treat well - 3/12.DEPPART
\ps prefix-  vta                      - infl  infl+prefix- prefix- vta        - infl
\ft And we will forgive those who don't treat us well.
\ref Con101.011
\tx Cih'oo'eixohei'ee
\mb cih-     'oo'eixoh              - ei'ee
\ge to here- gather people together - 1PL.IMPER
\ps prefix-  vta                    - infl
\tx heetnonoxoo3oo'.
\mb heet-       nonoxoo3oo      - '
\ge where-      cruel, terrible - 0S
\ps prefix.rel- vii             - infl
\ft Guide us away from where it is bad.
\ref Con101.012
\tx Nuhu' heetwotoxoobee'                  hiine'etiit.
\mb nuhu' heet-       wotoxoobee    - '    hiine'etiit
\ge this  where-      unclean, evil - 0S   life
\ps det   prefix.rel- vii           - infl ni                 
\ft Where there is this awful life.
\ref Con101.013
\tx Heetihcihnookoote'eixohei'een.
\mb heetih-  cih-     'ookoote'eixoh          - ei'een
\ge so that- to here- lead s.o. towards  home - 2S/1PL
\ps prefix-  prefix-  vta                     - infl
\ft Take us towards home.
\notes 'okoote'eixoh- lead us in a changed direction??? 
\ref Con101.014
\tx Heetciini'oo'.
\mb heet-       cii-    ni'oo - '
\ge where-      NEG-    good  - 0S
\ps prefix.rel- prefix- vii   - infl 
\ft Where it is evil/bad.
\ref Con101.015
\tx Nee'eesoo'.
\mb nee'eesoo  - '
\ge it is thus - 0S
\ps vii.back   - infl

\ft Amen.

\id Conathan 102: Joanne Birdshead gives a prayer
\ref Con102.001
\tx 'ine neixoo  Houu.
\mb 'ine neixoo  houu
\ge okay father! God
\ps part na.voc  na 
\ft Ok my father God.
\ref Con102.002
\tx Neneenin       beehiiniisonoonibeihin.
\mb neneeni-  n    beehiiniisonoonibeihi - n

\id Conathan 110: Dickie Antelope tells the story of how Nih'oo3oo Lost his Eyes
Note: many grammar errors and reanalyses in this text. Speaker also may be using -nino consistently for 0PL,
and/or treating 'eyes' as animate.
\ref Con110.001
\tx Nihii   he'ih'oowusiihiP.
\mb nihii   he'ih-    'oowu-    niih-   P
\ge well... NARRPAST- down-     along-  pause/break
\ps part    prefix-   prefix-   prefix- P

\ft Well down....
\ref Con110.002
\tx Nih'oo3oo    he'ih'oowuniihisee                 niiciihehe'.
\mb nih'oo3oo    he'ih-    'oowuniihisee            niiciihehe'
\ge White person NARRPAST- walk down along (stream) at a river
\ps na           prefix-   vai                      ni.loc

\ft White Men was walking down the river.
\ref Con110.003
\tx He'ih'e3ebiini           3ebiini        nihii   3eboowuniihis.
\mb he'ih-    'e3ebi- ini    3ebi-   ini    nihii   3eb-    oowuniihisee
\ge NARRPAST- there-  DETACH there-  DETACH well... there-  walk downstream
\ps prefix-   prefix- deriv  prefix- deriv  part    prefix- vai

\ft Then he went farther on down along the river.
\ref Con110.004
\tx Ne'nihnoohowoot,              ne'nihnoohowoot               nihii
\mb ne'-    nih-    noohow - oot  ne'-    nih-    noohow - oot  nihii
\ge then-   PAST-   see    - 3S/4 then-   PAST-   see    - 3S/4 well...
\ps prefix- prefix- vta    - infl prefix- prefix- vta    - infl part

\tx nii'ehiiho         ko'sineni3i               hohooti'.

\ge bird      - OBV.PL land (from flying) - 4PL  tree   - LOC
\ps na        - infl   vai                - infl na     - infl

\ft Then he saw, he saw birds that had landed in the trees.
\ref Con110.005

\ge meaningless form in Nih'oo3oo story said.3S    this  little bird
\ps part                                vai.IMPERF det   na.dim

\ft The little bird said "3oo3ookoocei'i."

\ref Con110.009
\tx Heesiitousinihiitoon                    _____  beteino,       isn't it?
\mb hees-       ii-     tousinihiitoon      *_____ hitei  - no

\notes I.e. speaker wanted to say that the eyes were stuck on the branches of the tree. 
Treats hitei 'branch' as if 3.POSS form hi-tei, thus be-tei, INDEF.POSS form (which actually does not exist)

\ref Con22.001

\id Conathan 30: My Childhood Horses, by Mary Kate Underwood
\ref Con30.001
\tx Cenih'iisiii'oonoo            nebesiiwoho'        nihniiih'oh'u3i',              noh
\mb cenih-      'iisiii'oo - noo  ne-   besiiwoho'    nih-    niiih'oh'     - u3i'   noh
\ge IC.to here- grown      - 1S   1S-   grandfathers  PAST-   raise (child) - 3PL/1S and

\tx nei'eibehe'.
\mb ne-   i'eibehe'
\ge 1S-   grandmother
\ps infl- na.oblposs

\ft When I was growing up my grandfathers raised me, and my grandmother.
\ref Con30.002

\mb ne'-       e'inooti        - noo  nuhu' tohuu-        P           ne-   i'eibehe'   noh

\mb ne-   besiibehe'  tih-       nee   - 3i'  tih-       niiih'oh'     - u3i'

\ref Con30.003

\ps proclitic- prefix-      prefix- vai.t    - infl det   ni                  - infl

\ft That's when they really enjoy eating pounded meat.

\id Conathan 63: Ardeline Spotted Elk talks about the old days
\ref Con63.001

\ref Con63.011
\tx Nihco'oniinikotiini'             nuhu' huut hoowuniihiihi'    nuhu' ho'.

\id Conathan 65: Ardeline Spotted Elk talks about her children's graduation
\ref Con65.001
\tx Nuhu' neih'e           noh  nehe' notoone
\mb nuhu' ne-   ih'e       noh  nehe' no-   toone
\ge this  1S-   son        and  this  1S-   daughter

\tx tihbeetou3ei3i',                   nih'eeneti3i'.
\mb tih-       beetou3ei        - 3i'  nih-    'eeneti - 3i'
\ge when.PAST- finish education - 3PL  PAST-   speak   - 3PL
\ps prefix-    vai.o            - infl prefix- vai     - infl

\ft When my son and daughter graduated they spoke.
\ref Con65.002
\tx Noh  nehe' 3oo3ouuteiseet       neneenit       nih'ini
\mb noh  nehe' 3oo3ouuteisee - t    neneeni-  t    nih-    'ini
\ge and  this  IC.walk ridge - 3.S  IC.it is- 3.S  PAST-   DETACH
\ps part det   vai.incorp    - infl vai-      infl prefix- deriv

\tx heenei'towuunoot     heetneeneisinihii-3i'                  hinono'einiihi'.
\mb heenei'towuun - oot  heetn-  eeneisi-          nihii - 3i'  hinono'ein- iihi'
\ge tell things   - 3S/4 FUT-    what/how-         say   - 3PL  Arapaho-    ADV
\ps vta.REDUP     - infl prefix- prefix.rel.REDUP- vai   - infl prefix-     deriv

\ft And Ridge-Walker told them what to say in Arapaho.
\ref Con65.003
\tx Nih'ee3neeniini          hiisiitenou'u.
\mb nih-    'ee3neen- iini   hiisiiten  - ou'u
\ge PAST-   very-     DETACH seize/take - 3PL
\ps prefix- prefix-   deriv  vti        - infl

\ft They really caught on to it.
\ref Con65.004
\tx Noh  howoo tihbeetou3ei3i'                    hinee tih'ini
\mb noh  howoo tih-       beetou3ei        - 3i'  hinee tih-       'ini
\ge and  also  when.PAST- finish education - 3PL  that  when.PAST- DETACH
\ps part part  prefix-    vai.o            - infl det   prefix-    deriv

\tx heeneti3i'     cih'eeneinono'eiti3i'.
\mb heeneti - 3i'  cih-     'eeneinono'eiti     - 3i'
\ge speak   - 3PL  to here- converse in Arapaho - 3PL
\ps vai     - infl prefix-  vai.REDUP.incorp    - infl

\ft When they talked at their graduation, they spoke in Arapaho.
\ref Con65.005
\tx Nuhu' neniteeno' nee3neeniini          no'oteenowoo3i'
\mb nuhu' neniteeno' nee3neen-      iini   no'oteenow          - oo3i'
\ge this  people     really/very-   DETACH think much of/adore - 3PL/4
\ps det   na.pl      prefix.IMPERF- deriv  vta                 - infl

\tx tihcih'eeneinono'eiti3i'.
\mb tih-       cih-          'eeneinono'eiti     - 3i'
\ge when.PAST- DUBIT(arch.)- converse in Arapaho - 3PL
\ps prefix-    prefix-       vai.REDUP.incorp    - infl

\ft The people really looked up to them for speaking Arapaho.
\ref Con65.006
\tx Ni'i3ecoot       nehe' 3oo3ouuteiseet       tihnee'eestoo3i'.
\mb ni'i3ecoo - t    nehe' 3oo3ouuteisee - t    tih-       nee'eestoo   - 3i'
\ge be happy  - 3.S  this  IC.walk ridge - 3.S  when.PAST- do thus/that - 3PL
\ps vai       - infl det   vai.incorp    - infl prefix-    vai.back     - infl

\ft What they did really made Ridge-Walker happy.
\ref Con65.007
\tx Noh  bisiihi'      nuhu' hiniiteh'eihinoo                  bisiihi'
\mb noh  bis-    iihi' nuhu' hini- iteh'eih          - inoo    bis-    iihi'
\ge and  all-    ADV   this  3S-   friend(s)         - pers.PL all-    ADV
\ps part prefix- deriv det   infl- na.oblposs+plposs - infl    prefix- deriv

\tx nihno'oteenebei3i'.
\mb nih-    no'oteeneb                    - ei3i'
\ge PAST-   think a lot of/admire/respect - 4/3PL
\ps prefix- vta                           - infl

\ft All their friends thought highly of them.
\ref Con65.008
\tx Nohuusoho'.
\mb nohuusoho'
\ge like that
\ps part

\ft That's it.

\id Conathan 66: Mark Soldierwolf gives old Arapaho Personal Names
\ref Con66.001
\tx 3eboosei3iihi'                    nono3P               nooxeihi'
\mb 3eboosei3-                  iihi' nono3-   P           nooxeihi'
\ge there back (time or place)- ADV   earlier- pause/break maybe
\ps prefix-                     deriv prefix-  P           part

\tx tih'iine'etiit               nehe' nono'ei,
\mb tih-       'iine'etii - t    nehe' nono'ei
\ge when.PAST- live       - 3.S  this  Arapaho
\ps prefix-    vai        - infl det   na

\ft Back there earlier maybe when/how the Arapaho lived,
\ref Con66.002
\tx Nihii   nihniisih'eti3i'               hinono'eino'
\mb nihii   nih-    niisih'eti      - 3i'  hinono'eino'
\ge well... PAST-   name o.s./e.o.  - 3PL  Arapahos
\ps part    prefix- vai.refl/recip  - infl na.pl

\tx tih'etne'inon[ot]eihi3i'    niisih'it,             nehe'
\mb tih'etn-  e'inoneihi - 3i'  niisih'i        - t    nehe'
\ge IRREALIS- known      - 3PL  named           - 3.S  this
\ps prefix-   vai.pass   - infl vai.PASS.IMPERF - infl det

\tx koto'uusiihi'                             hiniisih'iit.
\mb koto'uus-                           iihi' hi-   niisih'iit
\ge in particular, each particular one- ADV   3S-   name
\ps perfix-                             deriv infl- vti

\ft The Arapahos named themselves so that each one would be known by a particular name.
\ref Con66.003
\tx Nihii   nee'inoneihit          nehe' nihniisih'eet,
\mb nihii   nee'inoneihi    - t    nehe' nih-    niisih'ee    - t
\ge well... known           - 3.S  this  PAST-   named/called - 3.S
\ps part    vai.PASS.IMPERF - infl det   prefix- vai.mid      - infl

\tx nih'iiscebeno'                              nuhu' nihii   niisih'iit,
\mb nih'iis-           ceben             - o'   nuhu' nihii   niisih'iit
\ge PAST.what/how-     pass s.t. to s.o. - 3S   this  well... name
\ps prefix+prefix.rel- vti               - infl det   part    ni

\tx neeneisceecebenou'u.
\mb neeneis-                 cee-    ceben             - ou'u
\ge what/how-                REDUP-  pass s.t. to s.o. - 3PL
\ps prefix.rel.REDUP.IMPERF- prefix- vti               - infl

\ft That's how the person who gave the name was passed on, and how people would pass names on.
\ref Con66.004
\tx Tih'etceeh'ei3i'                      hiniisih'iit.
\mb tih'et-      ceeh'ei           - 3i'  hi-   niisih'iit
\ge IRREAL.PAST- cedar/use incense - 3PL  3S-   name
\ps prefix-      vai.o             - infl infl- vti

\ft They would cedar for this name.
\ref Con66.005
\tx Wohei neeneitowuuhu'      hineniiniini     niisih'iitono

\ps part  prefix.REDUP- deriv prefix-   deriv  ni         - infl

\tx heetneenetinoo.

\ps prefix- vai    - infl

\id Conathan 69: Chuck Gambler talks about sign language
\ref Con69.001
\tx Nih'iiniitowootiini'                              niibeethe'inou'u,
\mb nih'ii-      niitowootiini                 - '    nii-    beet-    he'in - ou'u

\mb tih-       'eeneti3 - o'    ne-   besiibehe'

\ps prefix-    vta      - infl  infl- na.oblposs

\ps prefix-          prefix-  vai.o             - infl

\ref Con69.002

\id Conathan 78: Chuck Gambler talks about Arapaho religious life and the Eagle Drum
\ref Con78.001
\tx Wohei nihii   niiyou            niiboot, 'oh     niibootou'u    nii'ehiiho'.

\mb neene'eeno'

\ps pseudovai

\ref Con78.003

\ref Con78.007

\tx Neneenit       nihnii3inoot           ho'eiho'.

\id Conathan 80: Mary Kate Underwood talks about Dutch Oven bread
\ref Con80.001
\tx Nei'eibehe'       nihniistiit            co'oc.
\mb ne-   i'eibehe'   nih-    niistii - t    co'oc
\ge 1S-   grandmother PAST-   make    - 3.S  bread
\ps infl- na.oblposs  prefix- vai.t   - infl ni

\ft My grandmother would make bread.
\ref Con80.002
\tx Nihniistiit            nuhu' co'oc.
\mb nih-    niistii - t    nuhu' co'oc
\ge PAST-   make    - 3.S  this  bread
\ps prefix- vai.t   - infl det   ni

\ft She would make this bread.
\ref Con80.003
\tx "Dutch oven" ni'iitou'u            nuhu' nih'oo3ou'u.
\mb Dutch  oven  ni'iit         - ou'u nuhu' nih'oo3ou'u
\ge Dutch  oven  call s.t. thus - 3PL  this  White people
\ps ENGL   ENGL  vti            - infl det   na.pl

\ft The white people call it Dutch oven.
\ref Con80.004
\tx Ne'nih'ii'bii3wooneino'                  cee'ei'i.

\ref Con90.001

\ref Con82.001

\id Old Hair Style, by Mary Kate Underwood
\ref Con24.001
\tx Nehe' betebihehihi'    hii3e'     hoowuniihiihi'    heetiine'etii3i'.

\ps det   na.dim           part.loc   prefix-     deriv prefix.rel- vai       - infl

\tx Nih'inihii               hiceii3oowut.
\mb nih-    'ini   - hii     hiceii3oowu                     - t

\ref Con24.003

\ps part det                  na.pl       part det                  na    - infl

\ps prefix- deriv  prefix- vta     - infl  det   na    - infl

\id What My Elders Taught Me, by Mary Kate Underwood (= Con20)
\ref Con20.001
\tx Niitowuuhu'          nuhu' beh'eihoho' nih'iiseenetisi3i'
\mb niitow-        uuhu' nuhu' beh'eihoho' nih'iis-   eenetis  - i3i'
\ge leading/first- ADV   this  old men     PAST.PERF- speak to - 3PL/1S
\ps prefix-        deriv det   na.pl       prefix-    vta      - infl

\tx tih'eenei'towuuni3i'                       heeyouhuu.
\mb tih-       'eenei'towuun          - i3i'   heeyouhuu
\ge when.PAST- tell s.o. about things - 3PL/1S thing
\ps prefix-    vta.redup              - infl   ni

\ft First of all [this is what] these old men used to say to me when they told me things.
\ref Con20.002
\tx Nihii,  nuhu' beh'eihoho' nih'eeneisinihiisi3i'
\mb nihii   nuhu' beh'eihoho' nih-    'eeneisi-         nihiis       - i3i'
\ge well... this  old men     PAST-   whatever/however- say to/about - 3PL/1S
\ps part    det   na.pl       prefix- prefix.rel.redup- vta          - infl

\tx nih'eeneisiiseineebi3i',                     nih'ee3neeniini
\mb nih-    'eeneis-          iiseineeb - i3i'   nih-    'ee3neen- iini
\ge PAST-   what/how-         advise    - 3PL/1S PAST-   very-     DETACH
\ps prefix- prefix.rel.REDUP- vta       - infl   prefix- prefix-   deriv

\tx nei'enowoo:
\mb nei'en       - owoo
\ge hold tightly - 1S
\ps vta          - infl

\ft Well, I've really held on to the way these old men used to talk to me and advise me:
\ref Con20.003
\tx Nuhu' hiini3ecoo     tih'eenei'towuuneenoo.
\mb nuhu' hiini3ecoo     tih-       'eenei'towuunee   - noo
\ge this  mind, thoughts when.PAST- told about things - 1S
\ps det   ni             prefix-    vai.redup.MID     - infl

\ft The ideas [I heard] when they told me about things.
\ref Con20.004
\tx 'oh     hini'                nei'oonoyoohootowoo                nuhu' beh'eihoho'
\mb 'oh     hini'                nei'-    oonoyoohoot        - owoo nuhu' beh'eihoho'

\ps part    det                  prefix-  vti                - infl det   na.pl

\tx heeneisinihiinoo3i,                heenei3ei'towuuninoo3i
\mb heeneisi-         nihii - noo3i    heenei3-          ei'towuun - inoo3i
\ge whatever/however- say   - 3PL.ITER what/how-         tell s.o. - 3PL/1S.ITER
\ps prefix.rel.REDUP- vai   - infl     prefix.REDUP.REL- vta       - infl

\tx ne'nih'iisini,                       ne'nih'iisinihiinoo.
\mb ne'-       nih'iis-           ini    ne'-       nih'iisi-          nihii - noo
\ge that-      PAST.what/how-     DETACH that-      PAST.what/how-     say   - 1S
\ps proclitic- prefix+prefix.rel- deriv  proclitic- prefix+prefix.rel- vai   - infl

\ft I really watch what these old men, what they told me, I'm saying that.
\ref Con20.005

\ge Arapaho-   thought      - 2PL  - SUBJ FUT-    own        - 2PL
\ps prefix-    ni           - infl - infl prefix- vai        - infl

\ft Whatever you are thinking, if you want to think in the Arapaho way, you're on your own.
\ref Con20.055
\tx Wo'ei3 he'eetP                              woow     xookunih'oo3ounibe.
\mb wo'ei3 he'-       he-   et-     P           woow     xooku-   nih'oo3ouni  - be
\ge or     DUBIT-     2S-   FUT-    pause/break now.PERF through- be White     - 2PL
\ps part   proclitic- infl- prefix- P           part     prefix-  vai          - infl

\ft Or maybe you will be a complete white now.
\ref Con20.056
\tx 'oh     he'iinosounotiitiibe                        hi'in
\mb 'oh     he'ii-            nosou-  notiitii   - be   hi'in
\ge but/and DUBIT.IMPERF-     still-  search for - 2PL  that(aforementioned)
\ps part    proclitic+prefix- prefix- vai.t      - infl det

\tx cee'iyoono,                       ni'iihi',
\mb cee'iyoo                  - no    ni'iihi  - '
\ge payment/thing distributed - NI.PL called   - 0S
\ps ni                        - infl  vii.pass - infl

\ft But I guess you all are still looking for those paychecks, as they're called.
\ref Con20.057
\tx He'iiniiniitobe'eekuube,                              'oh     he'iiciinono'eitibe.
\mb he'ii-            nii-    niitobe'eekuu       - be    'oh     he'ii-            ciinono'eiti      - be
\ge DUBIT.IMPERF-     REDUP-  stand first in line - 2PL   but/and DUBIT.IMPERF-     not speak Arapaho - 2PL
\ps proclitic+prefix- prefix- vai                 - infl  part    proclitic+prefix- vai.incorp.NEG    - infl

\ft And I guess you are standing first in line for them, but I guess you don't even speak Arapaho.
